column1: Lognes is a community in the eastern suburbs of Paris
column2: France. It is located in the Seine-et-Marne department in the Île-de-France 20.7 km (12.9 mi) from the center of Paris.

column1: The community of Lognes is part of the Val Maubuée sector
column2: one of the four sectors in the "new town" of Marne-la-Vallée.

column1: The inhabitants are called the Lognots.
Lognes has the highest proportion of Asians of any town in France
column2: over 40% of the population being of Asian descent
column3: almost exclusively being or having ancestry from the former colonies of French Indochina (Cambodia
column5: and Vietnam). Ethnic business districts and community associations serving the Asian population are found throughout the city
column6: in contrast to the circumstances coming from quick assimilation often characteristic of the Vietnamese
column8: and Cambodian populations in France.As of 1998

column1: Lognes is served by Lognes station on Paris RER line A.
The town has the following primary school groups (preschool and elementary school):
Groupe scolaire Le MandinetThere are two junior high schools
column2: Collège Le Segrais and Collège La Maillière
column3: and one senior high school/sixth-form college
column4: Lycée Emily Brontë.Lognes has the following tertiary educational institutions:

column1: Ecole Supérieure de Management en Alternance
Polytheig école des hautes études d’information et de gestionCentre de formation d’apprentis SUP’TG is in Marne-la-Vallée. University of Marne-la-Vallée is in Champs-sur-Marne.
